pr_title: Clean up wire test case a bit

timeline.message:
Clean up wire test case a bit

* Adds JavaDoc to `AbstractWireTestCase` and
`AbstractWireSerializingTestCase` so it is more obvious you should prefer
the latter if you have a choice
* Moves the `instanceReader` method out of `AbstractWireTestCase` becaue
it is no longer used.
* Marks a bunch of methods final so it is more obvious which classes are
for what.
* Cleans up the side effects of the above.

Clean up wire test case a bit

* Adds JavaDoc to `AbstractWireTestCase` and
`AbstractWireSerializingTestCase` so it is more obvious you should prefer
the latter if you have a choice
* Moves the `instanceReader` method out of `AbstractWireTestCase` becaue
it is no longer used.
* Marks a bunch of methods final so it is more obvious which classes are
for what.
* Cleans up the side effects of the above.

timeline.bodyText: is there a reason why AbstractWireSerializingTestCase is not preferred? from a bystander's point of view, I see ListCursor is Writeable
timeline.author: talevy

replies.bodyText: This is the one time that we override how the copying is done. I made that method final to make it more clear what is going on. This is the one case of collateral damage.
replies.author: nik9000

timeline.bodyText: Is Geometry the only user of this?
timeline.author: talevy

replies.bodyText: right, I suppose the previous comment answers that. guess its surface area is small, but provides enough utility! thanks
replies.author: talevy
